content: on method pm to mark the beginning of round ankle 1-8 knit all stitches 9 purl all stitches repeat rounds 1-9 of this section until you have reached your desired ankle length i knit 16 repeats in my socks notes on how to fade colours a-d throughout the pattern can be found on page 6 heel flap 1 rs knit 34 stitches turn to work wrong side 2 ws sl1wyif k33 turn to work right side 3 rs sl1wyif k33 turn to work wrong side continue to knit row 2-3 of this section 14 more times or until you have 15 garter ridges finish on a ws row this might require you to knit one extra ws row heel turn 1 rs sl1wyif k18 ssk k1 turn to work wrong side 2 ws sl1wyif p5 p2tog p1 turn to work right side 3 rs sl1wyif knit to 1 stitch before gap ssk k1 turn to work wrong side 4 ws sl1wyif purl to 1 stitch before gap p2tog p1 turn to work right side repeat row 3-4 of this section until you have no more stitches left at the end of each row if you do not finish on a ws row knit one extra ws row so that you can start the gusset section on a rs row gusset pick up and knit 15 stitches along one side of the heel flap place new beginning of round marker bor k34 place second marker pick up and knit 15 stitches along the other side of the heel flap k to bor marker � ©jacqui verbeek 2023 page �4 section round direction please note that for the foot decrease and foot sections you will be following the ankle pattern established in rounds 1-9 across the top of the foot the 34 stitches that are between the two markers i refer to this as the established pattern foot 1 k34 slip marker k1 ssk k to 3 stitches before bor marker k2tog k1 decrease 2 knit in the established pattern with no decreases repeat rounds 1-2 of this section until you have decreased your stitch count to 68 foot when you have finished your decreases and have 68 stitches continue to knit in the established pattern until you reach your desired foot length i always knit the foot to the top of my little toe before starting the toe section toe 1 k1 ssk k to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk k to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 2 k all stitches repeat rounds 1-2 of this section until you have 28 stitches remaining graft the final stitches together using the kitchener stitch this is a great tutorial to show the kitchener stitch https //youtu be/ bzuksxgyitk repeat all of the steps for your second sock gently block dry and wear your socks � ©jacqui verbeek 2023 page �5 fade recipe i ve detailed in the image below the method i used to fade colours a
